node.title: Covid-19 milestone: 90pc of eligible New Zealanders are now fully vaccinated
node.description: Ninety percent of eligible New Zealanders are now fully vaccinated, with the official count through overnight, Covid-19 Response Minister Chris Hipkins says.

node.title: Torrential rain: Flooding, evacuations and road closures in Canterbury and Wellington
node.description: Christchurch had more rain in one day yesterday than it usually has in one month. Audio

node.title: ‘Nightmare Alley’ Review: Seeing Is Believing. (Suckers!)
node.description: Guillermo del Toro’s latest movie tracks the sordid adventures of a carnival grifter played by Bradley Cooper.

node.title: C.D.C. panel will discuss blood clot risk linked to J.&J.’s vaccine.
node.description: On Thursday, agency advisers will review updated figures showing roughly nine deaths from the rare disorder, according to a federal official.

node.title: Grayden Lane Denham Convicted of Killing Grandparents, Sister, 3-Month-Old Nephew
node.description: On Tuesday, a Platte County, Missouri, jury found Denham guilty of four counts of first-degree murder, four counts of armed criminal action and other crimes.

node.title: Influx From Infrastructure Bill Expected to Help Amtrak's Worn Northeast Corridor
node.description: Amtrak and other passenger and freight rail companies are set to get over $60 billion for repairs and new projects from the $1 trillion infrastructure law.

node.title: Massive Los Angeles School District Pushes Back Deadline For Student Vaccination Mandate
node.description: On Tuesday night, the board of the Los Angeles Unified School District voted to move the vaccine deadline to the fall of 2022 for students 12 and older.

node.title: Car crashes through walls of Melbourne shopping centre, hitting six people
node.description: Four people are taken to hospital after a car crashes into the Northcote Plaza shopping centre in Melbourne's inner north.

node.title: 'End of my tether': Northland's tourism industry fears for future in traffic light red
node.description: Northland's tourism operators say that if they can not welcome visitors back to the region soon, there will not be an industry there in the not too distant future.

node.title: All Blacks hooker Codie Taylor re-signs ahead of 2023 World Cup
node.description: All Blacks, Crusaders and Canterbury hooker Codie Taylor re-signed with New Zealand Rugby to the end of 2025.

node.title: How one woman traded her way from a bobby pin to a house
node.description: Everyone has heard about how soul-destroyingly difficult it is to get on the property ladder. But one Californian has found her way into home ownership, starting with a bobby pin. Audio

node.title: 'So far, so good': Tourism Fiji confirms 75,000 bookings
node.description: If tourist bookings continue to come through Fiji will be well on its way to becoming a billion-dollar industry again, the head of the country's tourism sector says.

node.title: Green hydrogen production on the cards for Marsden Point refinery site
node.description: Refining New Zealand has launched an investigation to see if it can repurpose some of its facilities at its Marsden Point oil refinery to produce green hydrogen.

node.title: Waimea Dam investigation finds no wrongdoing
node.description: An investigation into the construction of the Waimea Dam has found no evidence of impropriety or hasty, uninformed decision-making, says Tasman Mayor Tim King.

node.title: Covid-19 protest leads to bus travel disruptions, road closures in Wellington
node.description: Metlink warned of delays to its bus services in downtown Wellington after protesters took to the streets just before midday.

node.title: Jordan texted Meadows to argue Pence could block election certification
node.description: Jordan's office said it was a message he had forwarded from a conservative Washington lawyer.

node.title: 3 companies charged with negligence in Southern California oil spill
node.description: The charge could cost each accused company millions of dollars.

node.title: The winds in Kansas are whipping up wildfires and dust storms.
node.description: By Alyssa Lukpat

node.title: Ukraine Urges EU to Sanction Russia Before it Can Invade So Move Isn't 'Meaningless'
node.description: "We have sanctions in place, we are ready to take additional sanctions if needed, and we will see" what happens, said EU Council President Charles Michel.

node.title: As Nancy Pelosi Opposes Stocks Ban, These Officials Have Made the Most From Trading
node.description: Over 220 more representatives and senators own individual stocks. Together, they held at least $225 million in stock assets during 2020.

node.title: NSW budget deficit blows out to almost $20b because of lockdown
node.description: The NSW budget deficit blows out by more than double what was forecast less than six months ago because of money spent on JobSaver and COVID support.

node.title: Border protest horseman changes plea to not guilty
node.description: A movie stuntman who rode his horse through crowds at two lockdown protests says he was given "ineffective counsel" when he was advised to plead guilty.

node.title: Federal budget update reveals $7 billion improvement in deficit
node.description: The forecast deficit for this year has been revised down by $7 billion, the Treasurer announces, as the economy recovers from the COVID-19 recession.

node.title: Child dies, several critically injured after jumping castle blown into air at school
node.description: Children fell from as high as 10 metres after wind picked up a jumping castle and threw it into the air at an end-of-year activity day at a Tasmanian primary school.

node.title: Winter electricity blackout: Contact, Genesis actions 'generally appropriate', Authority finds
node.description: The Electricity Authority has found that no undesirable trading situation occurred on the night of a massive power outage in August.

node.title: Reserve Bank appoints three new executives
node.description: The Reserve Bank has made three appointments to its executive leadership team, following the resignation and retirement of several members.

node.title: Murray Robertson sentenced to preventive detention for sexually assaulting teenager
node.description: A repeat sexual predator has been sentenced to preventative detention and jailed for at least 5 years for luring a teenager into a car and assaulting her.

node.title: Death in police custody: IPCA finds officers failed in duty of care
node.description: Three Taranaki police officers failed in their duty of care to a farm worker who died in custody at the Hāwera police station, the IPCA has found.

node.title: Lewis Hamilton knighted after F1 heartbreak
node.description: Hamilton was knighted by Charles, Prince of Wales, during a ceremony at Windsor Castle on Wednesday.

node.title: Santa Claus Girls continue tradition bringing cheer to children in need
node.description: The pandemic interrupted the Santa Claus Girls' yearly gift giving tradition, but now they are back bringing cheer to children in need.
